IP.Name: USBPD
IP.About: USBPD : Universal Serial Bus Power Delivery

RefParameter.Name: USBPD_DMA_Request
RefParameter.DefaultValue: No UCPD1_RX and UCPD1_TX DMA Channel

Condition.Diagnostic: No UCPD1_RX and UCPD1_TX DMA Channel
Both instances of UCPD must be active

RefParameter.Name: USBPD_VID
RefParameter.Description:
The Vendor ID is assigned by the USB Implementers Forum.
The Vendor ID for STMicroelectronics is 0x0483.

RefParameter.Name: USBPD_PID
RefParameter.Description: The Product ID is assigned by the USB Implementers Forum.

RefParameter.Name: USBPD_XID
RefParameter.Description: Outward facing identifier used to determine certification status of a PD product.

RefParameter.Name: GUI_V1_8_0_OR_NEWER
RefParameter.Description: GUI Version embedded in FW package.

RefParameter.Name: PE_SupportedSOPapos_P0
RefParameter.Description: SOP' is not supported by default

RefParameter.Name: PE_SupportedSOPquot_P0
RefParameter.Description: SOP" is not supported by default

RefParameter.Name: PE_SupportedSOPaposDBG_P0
RefParameter.Description: SOP' debug is not supported by default

RefParameter.Name: PE_SupportedSOPquotDBG_P0
RefParameter.Description: SOP" debug is not supported by default

RefParameter.Name: PE_DefaultRole_P0
RefParameter.Description:
When the UCPD instance is initialized to sink then the port role will always be sink.
When the UCPD instance is initialized to source then the port role will always be source.
When the UCPD instance is initialized to dual role then the port role can either be source or sink. By default it will be initialized to sink.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: The UCPD instance has been configured as dual role
The UCPD instance has not been configured as dual role

Condition.Diagnostic: Only available if the UCPD instance has been configured as source or dual role
Only available if the specification revision value is set to 3.0
